title: Trieste
summary: Trieste (/triˈɛst/ tree-EST,[3] Italian: [triˈɛste] (listen); Slovene: Trst [tə̀ɾst, tə́ɾst]; German: Triest [tʁiˈɛst] (listen)) is a city and seaport in northeastern Italy. It is located towards the end of a narrow strip of Italian territory lying between the Adriatic Sea and Slovenia, which lies approximately 10–15 km (6–9 mi) to southeast of the city. Croatia is about 30 km (19 mi) to the south.
